name: ILS Servo Car
description: Control a 4-wheel servo motor car using PCA9685 PWM driver. Perfect for young makers (ages 8-14) to build and program their own robotic car!
author: ILS

connections.servos: Connect to PCA9685 channels 0-3 (or custom channels)

tips: Start with low speeds (30-50) when testing
Servos may need calibration - adjust range if car doesn't move straight
Front left and rear left servos are mirrored automatically
Use curve functions for smooth turning movements
Drift functions create fun sliding turns!
Ensure adequate power supply for all 4 servos

exampleProjects.name: Basic Navigation
exampleProjects.description: Make the car move in a square pattern

exampleProjects.name: Remote Control
exampleProjects.description: Control car with buttons or sensors

exampleProjects.name: Line Follower
exampleProjects.description: Add IR sensors for line following

exampleProjects.name: Obstacle Avoider
exampleProjects.description: Use ultrasonic sensor to avoid obstacles
